newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - India little changed in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - India little changed in dull trade.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) were little changed in thin trade and premiums remained at high levels, sustained more by a lack of selling than any active buying.

"The market is waiting for an announcement on measures to boost capital markets which is due next week," said a broker, who warned that if nothing substantial happened the stock exchange could tumble.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed down 0.64 points, or 0.93 percent, at 68.57 points, with the premium over the local market at 20.39 percent compared with yesterday's 22.11 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index rose 11.81 points, or 0.36 percent, to 3,264.12.
The cancellation for the second time of a $125 million GDR issue from Century Textiles due to adverse market conditions had been expected, said the broker.
Century's existing GDR closed up $3.50 at $50.00/$60.00.
Still in the pipeline is telephone company VSNL's $800 million issue plus an offering from Indian Oil Corp lead managed by Goldman Sachs and CS First Boston.

In Korea, lack of supply in the GDR market was a more important factor than the country's worsening industrial strife and the Capel Korea GDR Index ended up 1.03 points or 3.29 percent, at 60.63, a premium of 60.81 percent over the local market, compared with yesterday's 56.34 percent.
The Korea Composite Index fell 2.52 percent or 15.82 points to a provisional 611.05.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended up 0.87 points or 0.91 percent, at 96.15, a premium of 6.80 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index rose 30.27 points or 0.44 percent to 6,875.02.
